channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 15 black sacks ripped open., 14th January
item.description:
Resident reporting there is a lot of black ripped bags, mainly household rubbish there are about 15 or more ripped open black bags, rubbish is now everywhere, glass & used nappies, rotten food all over the road & pavement. This is an ongoing issue and it is all at the back of Roman Way which is a turning off Crayford Road Crayford. Behind Coral betting shop is the best landmark for the crew. This is a matter of urgency as it is a health & safety issue and it is attracting vermin infestation if not cleared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Roman Way, Crayford, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vandals keep ripping-off notices from unprotected notice board, 14th January
item.description:
I am secretary of the Friends of South Hill Wood and Kingswood Glen. Since December, vandals have been removing notices about the work of the Friends Group and date of next volunteer session on almost a daily basis. They have also put graffiti on it. This is not a good look, and despite me keeping replacing notices, they are constantly being ripped off. We need a proper secure notice board in this location, like there is at the other entrance to the park (South Hill Road/Westmoreland Road).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 94-140, Westmoreland Road, Park Langley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Health and safety, 14th January
item.description:
Iam writing to raise a serious safety concern regarding a tree located along a public pathway used daily by children on their way to school. Tree branches are repeatedly falling, and several branches are growing through and around overhead cables. This issue has already been reported, however no action has been taken to date. I understand that a tree inspection was scheduled for 2025, but I can confirm that no inspection has been carried out so far. This situation presents a clear and ongoing safety risk, particularly given that this path is used every morning by school children and families. Falling branches or damage to cables could result in serious injury. If the tree cannot be properly maintained and made safe, then it should be cut back significantly or removed entirely to eliminate the risk. I would appreciate this matter being treated as urgent and confirmation of when appropriate action will be taken.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Westmoreland Avenue, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Recycling has not been collected for several weeks, 14th January

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clissold Crescent, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Driver of vehicle LA75 KCZ dumping plastic bin liners in green waste!, 14th January
item.description:
The driver of vehicle LA75 KCZ, who must have had a 7am slot at Churchfields this morning, was brazenly dumping full black bags of stuff, unopened, into the green waste. This is a clear contravention of the rules, means the green waste is polluted, and you should either be banning the individual or at least fining him. You will have his details on your booking system, obviously, so you know who the perpetrator is. The rest of us empty our bags and put them in the non-recyclable bin, or take them home for re-use. It's not fair that others ignore the rules and get away with it!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Churchfields Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
